item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Blackstone 将以 20 亿美元的交易收购 Tropical Smoothie Cafe
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引熟悉此事的人士报道，Blackstone 将以近 20 亿美元的价格（包括债务）收购餐饮连锁店 Tropical Smoothie Cafe。【原文：Blackstone is buying restaurant chain Tropical Smoothie Cafe for nearly $2 billion, including debt, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国银行业监管机构延长对 Capital One-Discover 交易的评论期
item.description: 美国银行监管机构周三宣布，他们将延长 Capital One 收购 Discover Financial 的征求意见期，以便有更多时间听取反馈意见。【原文：U.S. bank regulators announced Wednesday they were extending the comment period on Capital One's bid to acquire Discover Financial to allow more time for feedback.】

item.title: 星巴克西雅图店工会选举上诉败诉
item.description: 美国上诉法院周三驳回了星巴克关于该公司西雅图旗舰店工会赢得的选举无效的主张，因为该选举是在 COVID-19 大流行期间通过邮寄投票方式举行的。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Wednesday rejected Starbucks' claims that an election won by a union at the coffee company's flagship Seattle store was invalid because it was held via mail ballot during the COVID-19 pandemic.】

item.title: 机械需求趋于平稳，卡特彼勒和迪尔库存成为关注焦点
item.description: 卡特彼勒（Caterpillar）、迪尔（Deere）和凯斯纽荷兰工业公司（CNH Industrial）将在未来几周内公布季度业绩，届时设备库存将成为关注焦点，因为投资者正在等待有关需求的线索，预计今年设备行业将不温不火。【原文：Equipment inventories will be in focus when Caterpillar , Deere and CNH Industrial report quarterly results in the coming weeks, as investors await clues on demand in what is expected to be a lukewarm year for the sector.】

item.title: 布蒂格称波音公司在提高 737 MAX 产量前必须满足 FAA 的质量计划
item.description: 美国交通部长皮特-巴蒂吉格（Pete Buttigieg）周三表示，波音公司必须在90天内完成政府规定的任务，解决系统性的质量控制问题，然后才能提高737 MAX的产量。【原文：U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg said on Wednesday that Boeing must meet a government mandate to address systemic quality-control issues within 90 days before it will be able to boost 737 MAX production.】

item.title: 美国银行股东否决分拆首席执行官和董事长职位的提议
item.description: 美国银行股东周三在公司虚拟年会上否决了将布莱恩-莫伊尼汉（Brian Moynihan）担任的首席执行官和董事长职位分开的提议。【原文：Bank of America shareholders rejected a proposal to divide the CEO and chairman roles held by Brian Moynihan on Wednesday at the company's virtual annual meeting.】

item.title: TikTok 首席执行官期待击败美国的限制：我们哪儿也不去
item.description: TikTok 首席执行官周受资（Shou Zi Chew）周三表示，该公司有望赢得一项法律挑战，阻止乔-拜登（Joe Biden）总统签署的立法。【原文：TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew said Wednesday the company expects to win a legal challenge to block legislation signed into law by President Joe Biden that he said would ban the popular short video app used by 170 million Americans.】

item.title: 高盛首席执行官的领导力在年会上受到道德组织的批评
item.description: 倾向于保守派的国家法律与政策中心周三在高盛年会上批评了高盛首席执行官大卫-所罗门（David Solomon）的领导能力。【原文：The conservative-leaning National Legal and Policy Center criticized Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon's leadership at the bank's annual meeting on Wednesday.】

item.title: 瑞银因瑞信 170 亿美元债券损失面临阿帕卢萨的新诉讼
item.description: 美国对冲基金 Appaloosa LP 提起新诉讼，指控前瑞士信贷银行在政府策划的瑞士竞争对手瑞银集团（UBS）救援行动中将其 170 亿美元债券减记为零之前，在健康状况方面误导投资者。【原文：A new lawsuit by U.S. hedge fund Appaloosa LP accuses the former Credit Suisse of misleading investors about its health before $17 billion of its bonds were written down to zero in a government-orchestrated rescue by Swiss rival UBS .】

item.title: 消息人士称，高盛挖来美国银行的银行家担任印度交易职务
item.description: 三位直接知情的消息人士周三告诉路透社，高盛已在印度聘请了两位高级银行家，以利用南亚国家日益增长的交易和投资者兴趣。【原文：Goldman Sachs has hired two senior bankers in India to cash in on growing dealmaking and investor interest in the South Asian country, three sources with direct knowledge told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 特斯拉股东要求阻止马斯克在特拉华州以外提起薪酬诉讼
item.description: 根据一份法庭文件，一名特斯拉股东周三要求特拉华州法院阻止特斯拉和公司首席执行官埃隆-马斯克在特拉华州以外的地方就马斯克 2018 年的薪酬问题提起诉讼。【原文：A Tesla shareholder asked Delaware court on Wednesday to block Tesla and company CEO Elon Musk from litigating Musk's 2018 pay outside of the state of Delaware, according to a court filing.】

item.title: ASML 在年会上批准 Christophe Fouquet 担任首席执行官
item.description: ASML 已批准任命 Christophe Fouquet 为公司新任首席执行官。【原文：ASML has approved the appointment of Christophe Fouquet as the company's new CEO.】

item.title: Klarna 将在优步平台上提供支付服务
item.description: 瑞典的 Klarna 公司周三与优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）合作，在包括美国在内的一些市场为该公司的共享乘车和送餐平台提供支付服务。【原文：Sweden's Klarna on Wednesday partnered with Uber Technologies to offer its payment services across the company's ridesharing and food delivery platforms in a few markets, including the United States.】

item.title: 汇丰称中国财富增长助推客户在美投资
item.description: 汇丰银行美国和美洲区首席执行官迈克尔-罗伯茨（Michael Roberts）表示，汇丰银行在中国和香港的富裕客户仍然热衷于在美国投资。【原文：HSBC's wealthy clients in China and Hong Kong are still eager to invest in the U.S., according to Michael Roberts, the bank's CEO for the USA and Americas.】

item.title: 美国工人竞业禁止协议禁令面临大型商业集团诉讼
item.description: 美国最大的商业游说团体--美国商会周三提起诉讼，要求推翻联邦机构几乎全面禁止雇主要求工人签署不得加入竞争对手或创办竞争性企业的协议。【原文：The U.S. Chamber of Commerce, the country's largest business lobby, filed a lawsuit on Wednesday seeking to strike down a federal agency's near-total ban on employers requiring workers to sign agreements not to join rivals or launch competing businesses.】

item.title: 安费诺第一季度收入超出预期，宣布股票回购计划
item.description: 电子设备制造商安费诺（Amphenol）周三公布的第一季度营收超出市场预期，并宣布了一项新的 20 亿美元的股票回购计划，使该公司股价在盘前交易中最高上涨了 4%。【原文：Electronic equipment maker Amphenol beat market expectations for first-quarter revenue on Wednesday and announced a new $2 billion share buyback program, sending the company's shares up as much as 4% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 太阳能公司 SunPower 将裁员并关闭业务部门
item.description: SunPower 公司周三表示，作为帮助降低成本的重组工作的一部分，公司计划裁员并关闭某些业务部门，这使得这家太阳能公司的股价盘前下跌了 16%。【原文：SunPower said on Wednesday it plans to reduce its workforce and shut down certain business segments as part of a restructuring to help lower costs, sending the solar company's shares down 16% premarket.】

item.title: 美国完成向 CelLink 提供 3.62 亿美元贷款以建设汽车配线厂
item.description: 美国能源部贷款项目办公室周三表示，美国已向 CelLink 公司发放了一笔 3.62 亿美元的贷款，用于资助该公司在得克萨斯州建造一座工厂，生产电动汽车组装部件。【原文：The United States has closed a $362 million loan to CelLink Corp to help finance the construction of a plant in Texas to make components for electric vehicle assembly, the Department of Energy's loan programs office said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国 3 月份核心资本货物订单温和增长
item.description: 3 月份美国主要制成品资本货物的新订单量温和增长，而上个月的数据被下调，这表明第一季度企业的设备支出可能疲软。【原文：New orders for key U.S.-manufactured capital goods rose moderately in March and data for the prior month was revised lower, suggesting business spending on equipment was likely sluggish in the first quarter.】

item.title: 通用汽车首席执行官巴拉 2023 年薪酬下降 4%，降至 2780 万美元
item.description: 美国最大的汽车制造商通用汽车公司首席执行官玛丽-巴拉（Mary Barra）周三表示，通用汽车公司 2023 年的薪酬总额将下降 4%，降至 2780 万美元。【原文：General Motors CEO Mary Barra's total compensation in 2023 fell 4% to $27.8 million, the largest U.S. automaker said Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家报道谷歌竞争对手 Tuta 向欧盟技术监管机构投诉去排名问题
item.description: 德国电子邮件服务公司 Tuta Mail 向欧盟技术监管机构投诉，称在欧盟新技术规则生效当天，谷歌搜索结果突然下降。【原文：German email service Tuta Mail has complained to European Union tech regulators about what it described as a sudden drop in Google search results on the day the bloc's new tech rules kicked in.】

item.title: 微软在人工智能领域的领先地位令亚马逊的云计算霸主地位备受瞩目
item.description: 美国科技巨头即将发布的季报可能会显示，随着越来越多的企业转向微软的服务，微软正在缩小与云计算市场领头羊亚马逊公司的差距。【原文：Upcoming quarterly reports from U.S. tech giants may show Microsoft is closing the gap on cloud-computing market leader Amazon.com as more businesses switch to its services, attracted by a clutch of generative AI features that are powered by OpenAI's technology.】

item.title: TE Connectivity 传感器需求旺盛，季度利润超预期
item.description: TE Connectivity 周三公布的第二季度利润超出华尔街预期，主要得益于全球电动汽车（EV）制造商对其传感器技术的强劲需求。【原文：TE Connectivity beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit on Wednesday, helped by strong demand for its sensor technology from electric vehicle (EV) makers across the globe.】

item.title: 波音公司首席执行官称，MAX产量下降将减缓飞机制造商的复苏速度
item.description: 波音公司首席执行官戴夫-卡尔霍恩（Dave Calhoun）周三对员工说，波音737 MAX飞机产量的下降将减缓其复苏的步伐，因为在今年1月一架波音飞机发生令人痛心的空中爆炸事故后，波音将面临一段 "艰难 "的时期。【原文：Boeing's lower 737 MAX production will slow the pace of its recovery, as it faces a "difficult" period following a harrowing mid-air blowout on one of its jets in January, CEO Dave Calhoun told employees on Wednesday.】

item.title: 英国监管机构就微软和亚马逊的人工智能合作征求意见
item.description: 英国竞争监督机构周三表示，它正在就微软与 Mistral AI 以及亚马逊与 Anthropic 之间的人工智能合作征求意见。【原文：Britain's competition watchdog said on Wednesday it was seeking comments on the AI partnerships between Microsoft and Mistral AI, as well as between Amazon and Anthropic.】

item.title: CME 集团第一季度调整后利润因交易强劲而增长
item.description: 芝加哥商品交易所集团（CME Group）周三公布，第一季度调整后利润增长，原因是市场对其对冲市场波动的产品需求增加。【原文：CME Group reported an increase in first-quarter adjusted profit on Wednesday on higher demand for its products to hedge against market volatility.】

item.title: 医疗设备需求改善，赛默飞上调利润预期
item.description: 赛默飞（Thermo Fisher）周三的季度利润超过华尔街预期，并上调了全年利润预期，押注其用于药物开发的产品和服务需求将有所改善，股价盘前上涨约 4%。【原文：Thermo Fisher on Wednesday beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit and raised its annual profit forecast, betting on improved demand for its products and services used in drug development and sending shares up about 4% premarket.】

item.title: 日航总裁表示计划同时使用波音和空客飞机
item.description: 日本航空公司总裁鸟取光子（Mitsuko Tottori）周三表示，日本航空公司将继续同时使用空中客车和波音飞机。【原文：Japan Airlines will continue using both Airbus and Boeing aircraft, President Mitsuko Tottori said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 百健公司季度利润超出预期，阿尔茨海默氏症药物销售额大增
item.description: 由于老药面临激烈竞争，百健公司采取了一系列削减成本的措施，第一季度利润超过了华尔街的预期。【原文：Biogen beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit on Wednesday, helped by a series of cost-cutting measures as older drugs face fierce competition.】

item.title: 德州仪器乐观的第二季度业绩预期推动芯片类股走高
item.description: 德州仪器公司（Texas Instruments）在周三的盘前交易中大涨 7%，引发了芯片类股的反弹，因为该公司强劲的第二季度营收预期点燃了人们对芯片需求在多年低迷后回升的乐观情绪。【原文：Texas Instruments jumped 7% in premarket trade on Wednesday, sparking a rally in chip stocks as its strong second-quarter revenue forecast fanned optimism that chip demand was picking up after a years-long slump.】
